article.title: Dynamics of coupled phantom and tachyon fields

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the black dot in Figure 1 represent?
choices: An unstable saddle point.
An unstable node.
A stable attractor point.
A stable repeller point.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of point does Figure 2 illustrate for the given parameters (α = -0.3, λ = 1.9)?
choices: A stable node.
A stable focus.
An unstable saddle point.
An unstable spiral.
Effective energy density of the phantom field.
Effective pressure of the phantom field.
Effective equation of state for the phantom field.
Effective potential of the phantom field.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information does Table I provide about the coupling  Q = αp_m ?
choices: The location and stability of stationary points, as well as conditions for an accelerating phase.
The evolution of energy densities for different values of α.
The relationship between the phantom field and dark energy.
The numerical solutions for the coupled field equations.
Energy density of the tachyon field.
Equation of state for the tachyon field.
Potential of the tachyon field.
Coupling term between the tachyon field and dark matter.
